main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Crane, Bloomfield, and Vincennes, Indiana, on 17th September 1956 and 9th October 1956. The sightings included two unknown objects with changing colors and high-speed maneuvering, as well as an observation of a low-flying aircraft over Crane, Indiana in 1953.
interesting points: The UFOs described in the sightings displayed rapid speed, changing colors from white to red to green, and maneuvering as if chasing each other.
The objects were reported to be silent, with no sound heard and no vapor trails seen, and appeared to be larger than jets at their altitude of 2000 to 3000 feet.
One witness observed the UFOs giving off a glow which illuminated the surrounding area, adding to the mysterious nature of the sightings.
The sighting was recorded in an official U.S. Naval Ammunition Depot report, lending credibility to the eyewitness accounts.
The report also details an observation of a low-flying aircraft over Crane, Indiana, in 1953, which appeared silently and then disappeared silently.
sighted object: multiple unknown flying objects and low-flying aircraft
witnesses: CIV, members of Depot Fire Department, and civilian residents
